intro: Deinbollia fanshawei, commonly known as the Chinese sandmat, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and succulent leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in xerophytic plant physiology.
